docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 16 -- President Kennedy announced today that he had selected Robert F. Woodward, Ambassador to Chile, to be Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 16 -- President Kennedy announced today that he had selected Robert F. Woodward, Ambassador to Chile, to be Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs.
docs.abstract: Amb Woodward named Asst Sec of State for Inter-Amer Affairs; Morse hails choice; stresses need for clear line of authority

headline.main: Woodward, Career Man, Named Latin Affairs Head; Kennedy Fills State Department Post, Ending a Search of Four Months -- Two Ambassadors Are Appointed CAREER MAN GETS LATIN AFFAIRS JOB

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 16 -- Earlier this year, Eduardo V. Haedo, President of Uruguay, wrote to the State Department praising the outgoing United States Ambassador. He said that he had seen many able American diplomats in his country, but that none "has...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 16 -- Earlier this year, Eduardo V. Haedo, President of Uruguay, wrote to the State Department praising the outgoing United States Ambassador. He said that he had seen many able American diplomats in his country, but that none "has succeeded so well in defending the position of the United States while at the same time evidencing a deep comprehension of the people and problems of the Republic of Uruguay."

headline.main: Diplomat Without Pomp; Robert Forbes Woodward

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 18 (UPI) -- Senator Hubert H. Humphrey has informed the Kennedy Administration that he will not vote for the new foreign-aid program until he "gets some answers" on improvements in the program for Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 18 (UPI) -- Senator Hubert H. Humphrey has informed the Kennedy Administration that he will not vote for the new foreign-aid program until he "gets some answers" on improvements in the program for Latin America.
docs.abstract: Humphrey deplores mil aid stress in US aid, Sen subcom

headline.main: HUMPHREY SCORES PLAN ON LATIN AID; Will Oppose Kennedy's Bill If Set-Up Is Unchanged

docs.snippet: British pound sterling and Canadian dollar broke sharply in the foreign exchange market during the past week. Volume of business transacted was very heavy.
docs.lead_paragraph: British pound sterling and Canadian dollar broke sharply in the foreign exchange market during the past week. Volume of business transacted was very heavy.

docs.snippet: Ambassador Adlai Stevenson returns to Washington today from his trip to all ten South American countries. The project was a gamble which paid off handsomely. Except for minor hostile demonstrations here and there, Mr. Stevenson was warmly received....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ambassador Adlai Stevenson returns to Washington today from his trip to all ten South American countries. The project was a gamble which paid off handsomely. Except for minor hostile demonstrations here and there, Mr. Stevenson was warmly received. He performed his task of preparing the groundwork for the economic conference to be held in Uruguay next month.

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 21 -- Adlai E. Stevenson is convinced after having visited ten South American countries that the unsuccessful rebel invasion of Cuba has caused serious but reparable damage to inter-American relations.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 21 -- Adlai E. Stevenson is convinced after having visited ten South American countries that the unsuccessful rebel invasion of Cuba has caused serious but reparable damage to inter-American relations.
docs.abstract: Stevenson reptd convinced, after S Amer tour, that econ cooperation in depth will help overcome damaging effects of Cuban landing fiasco; sees econ deterioration since last tour in '60; speculation on rept

headline.main: STEVENSON FINDS U.S. PRESTIGE HURT; But Sees Loss Over Cuba as Reparable -- Will Ask More Economic Aid STEVENSON FINDS U.S. PRESTIGE CUT

docs.snippet: ACCRA, Ghana, June 22 -- South-West African nationalist leaders in exile warned a United Nations committee here today that, if the United Nations did not find a solution for their territory's problem of self-rule quickly, there might be bloodshed.
docs.lead_paragraph: ACCRA, Ghana, June 22 -- South-West African nationalist leaders in exile warned a United Nations committee here today that, if the United Nations did not find a solution for their territory's problem of self-rule quickly, there might be bloodshed.
docs.abstract: UN com in Ghana on tour to collect data on territory; warned of violence by nationalist leader M Karena unless self-rule issue is settled

headline.main: AFRICAN GIVES WARNING; Time Running Out, South-West Nationalist Tells U.N. Unit

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 22 -- The eighteen-day mission of Adlai E. Stevenson to South America has left in motion, with United States blessings, the most important diplomatic initiative to emerge in Latin America for collective action on the dangers...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 22 -- The eighteen-day mission of Adlai E. Stevenson to South America has left in motion, with United States blessings, the most important diplomatic initiative to emerge in Latin America for collective action on the dangers posed by Communist control of Cuba.
docs.abstract: Min Turbay Ayala sets trip to Panama, Brazil and Peru to win support for Pres Lleras plan to force Castro regime to define its ties with OAS and Hemisphere security system; Stevenson backed plan during Bogota talks; Brazilian support in doubt; Quadros views cited

headline.main: STEVEHSON BACKS PLAN ON CUBA TIES; Flies Home as Colombian Rallies Latins on Castro

docs.snippet: BERLIN, June 23 -- A relaxed and festive West Berlin tonight opened its eleventh International Film Festival with the announcement of a record participation by forty-seven countries.
